Class that handles some packets that are sent to the RouteModule-leader in a special way. More...

Detailed Description

Class that handles some packets that are sent to the RouteModule-leader in a special way.

Definition at line 29 of file RouteReader.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

RouteReader::RouteReader (  Queue *  q,
NetPacketQueue &  sendQueue,
MapSafeVector *  loadedMaps,
PacketReaderThread *  packetReader,
uint16  port,
uint32  definedRank,
char *  logName,
bool  superLeader,
vector< PushService * > *  wantedServices,
bool  waitForPush
) 
 

Creates a RouteReader according to the specifications.

Parameters:
q The queue into which we insert the request to be handled by the processor.
loadedMaps Where to look for the currently loaded maps.
preferedPort The port to use if possible
definedRank Value used when voting for leader. High value indicated that the system administrator want this Module to be leader.
logName is the name of a logfile if it exists.
superLeader True if the RouteModule should act as the old kind of leader and not send on SubRouteRequests to the availables. False for testing new leader-is-not-server functionality.
wantedServices Subscription services wanted by the module.
waitForPush True if the RouteModule should save the packets for a map until it has received a push packets for the map.

virtual RouteReader::~RouteReader (   )  [virtual]
 

Deletes the RouteReader and releases the allocated memory.

Member Function Documentation

bool RouteReader::leaderProcessCtrlPacket (  Packet *  p  )  [private, virtual]
 

Take care of some of the special control packets that might be received by the RouteModule-leader.

Calls the leaderProcessCtrlPacket in the super class to take care of the ``ordinary'' control packet.

Parameters:
p is the incoming control packet.
Returns:
true if the packet was handled here or by the method in the superclass, false otherwise.

Reimplemented from StandardReader.

bool RouteReader::leaderProcessNonCtrlPacket (  Packet *  packet  )  [private, virtual]
 

Takes care of the non control packets sent to the route leader.

Handles the RouteRequestPacket. NB! Deletes the packet or puts it in local queue for processing.

Parameters:
packet is the incoming packet to process.
Returns:
true if the packet was handled here, false if not.

Reimplemented from StandardReader.

void RouteReader::printOrigDests (  Head *  originList,
Head *  destList
)  [private]
 

Prints some information about the origin and destinations supplied.

Parameters:
originList The list of origins.
destList The list of destinations.

virtual bool RouteReader::usesCountryMaps (   )  const [inline, protected, virtual]
 

This module doesn't use country maps.

Reimplemented from StandardReader.
